messageBody:
So said sfranklinuk2002 on 2002-09-24

>Sorry, im not sure what exactly you mean, the class currently request
>information from the user via System.in.read(), are you saying that i
>should change this so that it actually requests the information from
>a custom class such as Custom.read(), where I can fill in the
>information from the testing class? Or have I missed the point?

System.in is global data. When an object talks to global data, it looks
like magic to the outside world. It makes testing difficult. It would
be better if the object didn't talk to global data. Instead, give the
object an InputStream to talk to. Then your tests can give it an
InputStream that wraps a String and your production code can give it an
InputStream that wraps System.in.

This way your tests can be automatic -- they do not require a user
typing something in.

Is that clearer?
